Graham Hovey — Letter from Italy'No. 2
Recorded in Rome November 18, 1953
Runs 14:25 with NAEB signoff
soy s a ^ 53

This is Graham Hovey, sending along another Letter from Italy
under a Rome dateline. These programs are produced for the National
Association of Educational Broadcasters with the cooperation of
Radio Xtallana.
In a previous Letter I reviewed the background and examined the
political position of Italy’s new prime minister, Giuseppe Pella. I
concluded that Signor Pella's political honeymoon as premier was about
over. But I added that the end of the honeymoon did not necessarily
mean the end of the Pella government.
I believe, however, that the end of the Pella honeymoon could
coincide with the end of the Pella government unless Italy gets some
kind of satisfaction soon on the politlcally-explosive question of
Trieste.
Let's be a bit more specific* Signor Pella will surely be In
deep political trouble if it becomes apparent that the United Gtates
and Britain are unable to carry out, at least in part, their decision
of October 8 to transfer Zone 4 of the Free Territory of Trieste to
Italy. And the young and delicate Italian democracy will be in trouble,
too.
It Is difficult to get across to most Americans how deeply most
Italians feel about this matter of Trieste. It is a feeling that cuts
across the linos of parties and factions; a feeling that seems to
affect Italians from north to south and all the way up and down the
social and economic scale.
